metadata.dc:title: tweepy Python Library
metadata.dc:creator: Open Source Contributers: https://github.com/tweepy/tweepy/blob/master/CONTRIBUTORS
metadata.dc:subject: OAuthHandler
tweepy.api
tweepy.Stream and tweepy.StreamListener
metadata.dc:description: Library Version: 3.9.0. Enables users to authenticate using and connect their client registered applications with Twitter using OAuth 1a Authentication.
Library Version: 3.9.0. Twitter API wrapper class provides a wrapper for the API as provided by Twitter
Library Version: 3.9.0. Twitter streaming API is used to download twitter messages in real time. tweepy.Stream establishes a streaming session and routes messages to StreamListener instance.

metadata.dc:title: TextBlob Python Library
metadata.dc:creator: Steven Loria
Open Source Contributers: https://github.com/sloria/TextBlob/blob/dev/AUTHORS.rst
metadata.dc:subject: textblob.blob.TextBlob
metadata.dc:description: Library Version: 0.15.3. A general text block, meant for larger bodies of text (esp. those containing sentences). Inherits from BaseBlob.
metadata.dc:title: Built in Python Library
metadata.dc:creator: Python Software Foundation
metadata.dc:subject: re - Regular Expressions
metadata.dc:description: Python Version: 3.8.2. Comes from re.py. A regular expression (or RE) specifies a set of strings that matches it.
metadata.dc:title: pandas Python Library
metadata.dc:subject: DataFrame
metadata.dc:description: Library Version: 1.0.5. pandas is an open source library providing high-performance, easy-to-use data structures and data analysis tools for the Python programming language. DataFrame is a two-dimensional, size-mutable, potentially heterogeneous tabular data.
metadata.dc:title: Dataset Column Variables
metadata.dc:creator: Vedant Gannt
metadata.dc:subject: Data Collection Dates
Column 1: Date
Column 2: Username
Column 3: Country Code
Column 4: Tweet Id
Column 5: Original Tweet
Column 6: Cleaned Tweet
Column 7: Tweet URL
Column 8: Sentiment Score
metadata.dc:description: First 100 rows of data points were collected at 2020-10-07 03:59:37 AM EST Second set of 100 rows of data points were collected at 2020-10-07 02:51:57 PM EST.

Column 1: All values in Date(YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss) column follow ISO 8601 for date and time specifications. This column is in UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) and tells the exact time that a tweet was posted to Twitter.
Column 2: Each value in Username column is the twitter handles or screen name of a user who posted a particular tweet

Column 3: Country Code column contains country codes of users'. Each is based off of a user's location as stated on their Twitter profile page. Codes follow ISO 3 form and users without a valid country code are given "None" as the value.
Column 4: Tweet Id field contains unique numbers that Twitter uses to identify specific tweets. Can be used in certain tweepy library functions.

Column 5: Original Tweet represents the text portion of the tweet that a user made. Tweets may have a https://t.co URL at the end of the text. This indicates that the tweet also contained media. The URL is the link to the tweet.
Column 6: Cleaned Tweet takes Original Tweet text and uses regex to remove punctuation, @'s handles, hashtag pharses, and URL's contained within the original text.
Column 7: Tweet URL column contains the URL for accessing tweets on Twitter's website. Tweet URL values are formed by: https://twitter.com/ + Username + /status/ + Tweet Id.

Column 8: Sentiment Score contains sentiment scores that are found by passing Clean Tweet text into the sentiment analyzer provided by TextBlob python library. All scores are between -1 and 1 inclusive. 1 means highly positive while -1 means highly negative.
